website_summaries.verdict: The OCZ Vector Series SSD would make a great investment for those moving on from using a hard drive as the main drive of their system.
pros: The OCZ Vector Series SATA III 2.5" SSD is fast and good-looking
It comes with cloning software and desktop accessories
cons: The Vector Series doesn't support hardware encryption, and is not as energy-efficient as its peers

customer_reviews.title: First drive crashed; second drive performing exceptionally in HTPC
customer_reviews.text: This particular drive has a high fail rate! Mine crashed after roughly 6 months of average use. The return process is lengthy but I did receive a newer version as a replacement. I wouldn't recommend putting anything important on this drive. Anything that can be re-installed is fine and be sure to back up your data. Outside of the failures, I put this in a HTPC with a fresh windows 7 install running Plex media server and the performance is amazing. fastest startup times I have ever seen (roughly less than 20 seconds boot to desktop).
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTNING IN A BOTTLE
customer_reviews.text: I'm a geek have to say. I have used Western Digital Velociraptor WD1600HLFS 160gb 3.5" Sata Desktop Drive which are pretty fast too but this drive blew it away. i use both in my Dell OptiPlex 780 with Intel processor e 8600 core 2 duo (3.33 ghz 1333 front bus speed) 16gigs of ram ,ge force 740,DELL U2410 IPS MONITOR and creative sb x-fi sound card and this drive is like lightning fast should I say any more I can't...I'M GONNA BUY THE OCZ VECTOR 150 256G FOR WHAT I PAID FOR THIS GET IT YOU'LL LOVE IT... WINDOWS EXPERIENCE RATING 6.8 THE DRIVE ITSELF 7.3
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Fast! FAST! FFAASSTT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently put this drive in my desktop PC to replace a. My "data" drive is actually a pair ofdrives in RAID0. Not only is this drive about 2X as fast as the 120GB OCZ, but it's close to 50% faster than the pair of drives in RAID0! The drive is a little thinner than the older OCZ drives so I suspect it fits in lower-profile laptops. One issue I've encountered is that my SATA cable clips don't catch and pull out easily. The only other drawback to the drive is that it's making me want to get rid of my older OCZ drives!
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: 5 Year Warranty?
customer_reviews.text: When I began to have a problem with this drive, I approached the manufacturer. It is 2 years into a 5 year warranty. Without looking at it I am being told it was user abuse...HUH? They won't issue an RMA. I realized the data corruption was likely do to a manufacturing defect in the Sata connector...it fits snugly but doesn't clip. The fact they won't issue an RMA is appalling, Just look at it to make a determination. Shame on them.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: just died after 6 years
customer_reviews.text: very happy with it for 6 years... now it's time to get a samsung pro , the ssd's have evolved a lot in all these years! do backups people, even SSD's will crash one day!!
customer_reviews.author: Jc D.

customer_reviews.title: OCZ does not back their products
customer_reviews.text: While this drive was amazingly fast when I fist installed it, it died totally within 3 months. I attempted an RMA with OCZ and they simply stopped responding to me. They are a sham of a company, I tried again recently to return the item, again they don't even acknowledge me at all. With companies like Intel and Samsung selling SSD's there is no reason to ever by a OCZ SSD. Avoid!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: The best upgrade I've ever installed for a computer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The best upgrade I've ever installed for a computer! The speed are extremely fast its crazy. My macbook takes roughly 10-15 seconds to restart and roughly 8-10 seconds to turn on from cold start. File and search and programs load extremely fast. Easy to install, and eggcellent build quality. I transferred original HDD OS/data no problem...been running like a champ since mid April. Cons: I have heard alot of horror stories of drives failing but I have yet to get a bad drive.
customer_reviews.author: Nick_17

customer_reviews.title: Its fast and it works.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked: Its fast, very fast. My benchmark tests had it doing 500MB/s seq writes. Easy to install as far as drives go. It came with a desktop adapter although this one went in a laptop. Because of the thin design it now fits in the Lenovo laptop I put it in. The agility III's we had would not fit snugly. What I Dislike: Nothing yet with the drive. OCZ support was a horror story to deal with in the past, so I'm hoping the drive works. This was purchased for my company, but I'd also purchase this for myself.
customer_reviews.author: KKG IT

customer_reviews.title: works well when it worked but ultimatly has reliablity issues.
customer_reviews.text: purchased this September 5, 2013 and as of today the refurbished one i received has finally died and i dont think i can RMA this one again to get a replacement. Worked well when it worked but i bought two of these to raid and both had to be RMA'd. i used this as the OS drive in my media PC and failed to be recognized when i rebooted it last night (7/22/2014). Pretty crapy IMO. not gona buy from OCZ again. 3 stars for their easy RMA procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Sovertop Tith

customer_reviews.title: Instead I have replaced it with an VTR150-25SAT3-120G and excellent work. Do not give it 5 stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hurt shortly after purchase, but shoulder the OCZ support as they have changed the hard drive smoothly, just asked me purchase information and the damage and I have changed the same covering them spending a year and a half later, the guarantee 5 years is real. Instead I have replaced it with an VTR150-25SAT3-120G and excellent work. Do not give it 5 stars because the product itself has left me wrong but with which I have replaced this perfect
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Mac Lean

customer_reviews.title: IT STORES YOUR P0RN!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for years now with nary a hiccup. Was expensive as hell back in the day and now OCZ is owned by someone else now (Toshiba?). That being said, all of my systems, sans one, run the Vector-series drives. I don't keep up with benchmarks anymore so not sure where these rank.
customer_reviews.author: BMW RT Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Fast when it works
customer_reviews.text: These SSDs are really fast, and really great, when they're not failing. Unfortunately many of them shipped with a firmware that will just corrupt your OS on a sunny day and have you raging out hard. In total, via work or personal, I've overseen the purchase of 4 of these. to my knowledge only 1 of those 4 has completely failed and had to be RMA'd 75% success rate? That's a C+ right? ie 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: MrChipsRevenge

customer_reviews.title: Good drive - lenghty warranty replacement process
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for testing. Out of a handful one failed after approximately 3 months. Died from one moment to the other - no chance of data retrieval. So open up the support ticket which leads to a first session of troubleshooting until you have convinced the other party that the drive is indeed dead. The case then get handed over to the rma department etc.. From the day the drive died till I had the clearly marked refurbished unit in hand it had easily been 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sassan Karai

customer_reviews.title: Stupid Fast.
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting 4 of these total to put into RAID 0. I'm backing it up, don't worry. But guess what? I now have read/write speeds around 2 GB/s. it's my boot drive on a Hackintosh. Amazon sent me 2 refurbs, though, instead of two new drives. weird, but they're being great about swapping out those for the new ones I ordered. It's hard to find 128GB drives with fast Read and Write speeds. Usually you have to start at 256GB to find something good, but these are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Excellent! Especially for the price.

customer_reviews.title: I Could Like It If It Worked
customer_reviews.text: Infant mortality. Ran just long enough to load the OS and start downloading updates to the OS from Microsoft and it died. From that point on it wouldn't show up in the bios or anywhere else. Other problems I have had with this series of SSDs is that they do not show up during OS install if you have two of them configured to be used as part of a raid. Thank you Amazon for letting me RMA it, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Mss'ty

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is not so easy to install because you have to follow some steps. If you are a computer engineer no problem. Once I've installed this drive as and additional for my PC, wow.... I used to do some VMWare demos and that Demos with Windows Servers VMs with HDD 7200 RPM used to take 45 mins, now less than 5 mins. This is a good I/O benchmark. For all performance uses I do recommend this drive. It worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Renato Y. Hirata

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT FIRMWARE UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these via Amazon, first one died extremely quickly due to firmware corruption which causes the drive to not be detected by any means. OCZ has put out a firmware update to fix this issue, so whatever you do, make sure the first thing you do is update the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Too many failures
customer_reviews.text: I had 3 of these drives fail in sequence of both 128GB and 256GB in size. Seems like bad QC, bad chip run, or bad firmware. It wasn't until the 4th drive on an RMA return (not retail replace as the others had been) that I got a good working drive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fast when it works; broke down after 3 weeks of using it; lost all data.
customer_reviews.text: This SSD drive was/is used as Win7 OS drive. After about 3 weeks of using it one application started to core dump. During next 15 minutes the damage was progressing, the whole systems started to crash (blue screen) and finally about 20 minutes later the disk disappeared completely (not even visible from bios). I checked that drive on other machine and it was not popping up in bios too. Finally I created a ticket with Amazon to return it as defective. Amazon sent me replacement in 3 days. Pros: Very fast when it works. Amazon logistics is awesome (shipping/return/shipping). Cons: It just failed after lass then for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrzej Nowosad

customer_reviews.title: very fast. good quality on this one with proper setup.
customer_reviews.text: very fast. good quality. still going strong. People's issues with OCZ are from different models, older controllers, firmware and lack of proper trim support in OS or config. This version has worked flawlessly in GNU+Linux from time of install.
customer_reviews.author: maxpowers

customer_reviews.title: Died.  Replaced.  Died again.
customer_reviews.text: Died after 6 months. Support was very helpful with things to try. Ended up sending it to them for replacement. Replacement process was very efficient/easy. However, I was sent a refurbished/replacement unit, and it died within 2 months.... Maybe I got 2 lemons, but I will never buy OCZ again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben K

customer_reviews.title: Unstable, fails. Buy the vertex 4 instead!
customer_reviews.text: Unstable.. I went through five of these, 3 were casual restarts, and 2 were whilst over clocking. Would NOT recommend this, but OCZ sent me a Vertex 4, and it has been alive for the past 8 months, running strong and super fast! Wish I would of purchased it in the first place. 3/5 stars for the superb customer support that OCZ has given me! I am a loyal customer to them for that!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these refurbished for $349.00 and after a few hours of use this ssd died! The comments below regarding the longevity of this product is for real! ! Save yourself the hassle and just skip this model SSD completely!
customer_reviews.author: 3b0ny69

customer_reviews.title: OCZ fails to honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: The drive worked fine for about 6 months and then it died completely. OCZ will not honor a warranty for an item purchased through Amazon. They will tell you “The limited warranty applies only to products purchased through an authorized retailer and only for the original purchaser of the product. Second hand sales are not covered under the warranty.” They claim Amazon is not an authorized dealer therefor will not honor any warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walsh

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: its fast... i love it... i got the 256GB model... I was scared of running out of space.. also have a 1TB & 2TB hdd installed in same desktop.. Starting installing a bunch of games onto the 1TB HDD... Virtual instrument libraries on the 2TB.. all thats left is music programs & DAWs for the SSD!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD with noticeable performance increase
customer_reviews.text: To all that have standard HDDs or Hybrids, just go for the gold and get thus SSD. This drive can handle anything and will shock and awe you with the speed increase you get when you replace those old mechanical drives with this drive. OCZ definately has a good line of SSDs that I will continue to buy in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive!!
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price, slick easy to install, I would recommend to anyone. My PC boots up so much faster. Installed the Operating system and a few programs on this drive and everything else on a second SATA drive. The programs installed on this SSD are so much faster gaming is cleaner,quicker than before. I just wish the price of SSD would come down quicker but I am glad I pulled the trigger on this drive and do not regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kingami

customer_reviews.title: Two Vectors. Two Dead SSDs.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this SSD. After a couple of months, the SSD died. All my files were gone and I had to reinstall Windows. While the RMA process was quick, the replacement was defective. OCZ Vector is notorious for bricking, even though its fast. Go with a Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Centient

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after a week OCZ does not honor warrenty
customer_reviews.text: Crashed after a Week. Went though all the hoops from OCZ to recover the drive, but my PC wont even detect it in the system BIOS. The I found out that OCZ doesn't honor warranty if you bought it from Amazon. So the "5 year warranty" stuff is all a big lie. Warrenty only works if you buy it directly from OCZ. Bad drive from and awful customer service from OCZ. DO NOT BUY THIS HARD DRIVE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Solid State Drive...for 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: This Solid state drive is fast, and I've been very impressed (5-star impressed) with it up until this week. I've had this for almost 9 months, and it's went and died on me. It has a 5-year warranty, so I'm not too upset about it, but it doesn't deserve over a 3-star regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Failed time and time again. Sent to OCZ to fix. They said it failed and sent me another replacement. Guess what? That one failed as well... I just gave up. OCZ basically running their own business into the ground. Too much competition out there as well.
customer_reviews.author: SWY

customer_reviews.title: Bought at value 2 yrs previous. Still amongst top of the line perfotmance...
customer_reviews.text: Awsome....Performance, I found it at great value... 2 yrs later still very competitive performance..... So much so the "Supply / Demand" pricing has increased...
customer_reviews.author: Nick...

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months, possibly caused BSOD's
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and to description until after one month my system started getting blue screens of death. Though it might not be the cause, it completely died after 3 months while investigating what was causing the BSOD's. I'll take my business elsewhere with the next ssd i buy.
customer_reviews.author: Biermark

customer_reviews.title: Super fast read and write SSD - love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this SSD. This is my 4th one from OCZ. I have them in our desktops and laptops for the primary drives. Super fast read and write and lasting well. I have a couple from 2 years ago, one from a year ago and this newer one, all doing their job great and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Ross

customer_reviews.title: OCZ Technology 256GB Vector Series SATA 6.0 GB/s 7 mm Height 2.5-Inch SSD
customer_reviews.text: OCZ is known for its firmware and overall quality in its SSDs. This is a big improvement over a HDD. I partitioned this drive into C,D and E drives and installed Windows 8 Pro on the C partition in no time...it was a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Techno Guy

customer_reviews.title: Unstable in Windows 8.1
customer_reviews.text: Was not stable in my windows 8 build. Driver Errors occurred when upgrading to 8.1. Required multiple re-installs before removing the drive. Replaced with a Seagate 1TB standard disk HD and all stability issues have gone away
customer_reviews.author: James Michael Hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: The speed of this SSD is amazing. My Mac now boots in 19 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Bought one to replace the boot drive in my Macbook Pro early 2011. The first one I received failed within a month, however the company replaced it quickly and without much hassle. The speed of this SSD is amazing. My Mac now boots in 19 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lee

customer_reviews.title: this ssd is fast but has reliability issues have had to RMA 2 times in 4-5 months
customer_reviews.text: this thing performs like a dream just be sure you update the firmware before you install an os on it otherwise you will lose all data on disk and have to start over well i later had an issue where i have killed 2 of these and had to RMA it 2 times in 4-5 months so you do the math.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Shop around for something better.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, But after having it for the first month had to RMA it. We it was returned it seems the drive is slower than it was before and Data files keep getting corrupt.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Adorno

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. No problems whatsoever, and OCZ is giving Far Cry 3 for free. Great! I have not made any performance tests or anything. Just hope it stays working flawlessly during a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ferabreu

customer_reviews.title: Fast Fast Fast
customer_reviews.text: Pros- Blazing fast speed - 5 year warranty - Installation was a breeze - I just did a fresh Windows install but the Drive Cloning software was simple enough Cons- Should have bought a bigger drive than the 128GB - Will never be happy with a mechanical Hard Drive again
customer_reviews.author: Matt Grafton

customer_reviews.title: Stability problems.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong the product is fast however after a 5 months of use, the SSD died on me. It seems i was not the first one to have this problem. (no problem on the RMA). Stability is very important to me, even if the speed of the product is great if the stability is not good then the product is not good. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Tovar

customer_reviews.title: Best SSD to date
customer_reviews.text: Blazingly fast speed, very reliable storage. Instant start, nano-second access to apps, no disc means higer durability and even faster access speeds than a regualr disc hard drive. According to my research, this is the fastest SSD available today. Outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: RMA'd once and sending the send one back as it also broke.....
customer_reviews.text: RMA'd once and sending the send one back as it also broke.....
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Software don't work with windows 8
customer_reviews.text: I bought OCZ because spec says it is the best. Amazon ad stated Acronis is included that works with Windows. (Bundled with a 3.5-inch desktop adapter bracket and an Acronis True Image cloning software registration key (Windows compatible) to easily transfer data from your old hard drive. ) The software furnished does not work with Windows 8. The drive works fine, but I will have to buy the software for $49.99 to maintain it. Making the cost much more than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome in every way. This drive has the speed and agility I wanted. It is pretty high up there In benchmark statistics. Fast, very cool, very compact, very high quality construction. Thing is perfectly silent. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Chatty

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these in production along with the 256GB version. The drive is fast and feels well constructed. Let's hope they are a little more reliable than the Vortex series. Two of these are RMA's for Vortex drives
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rutan

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: A great SSD for the price. The capacity has worked out great for our use and the drive has had zero slowdowns. We have six of the 512GB version in a raid 10 array at work. Great for development VM storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hatley

customer_reviews.title: Had to RMA new one died too
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year. OCZ sent me a refurb that worked for a few months and it died too.
customer_reviews.author: frisbeecoach

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly researched this product and found it to be the best of its kind, great capacity, speed and efficiency. Although a bit pricey it is a good investment for a high-level system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this hard-drive since December of 2012. In the time between then and July 2013, it managed to completely corrupt the system files and recovery partition a whole seven times before merrily becoming absolutely dead by the end of July. I'm waiting to see if OCZ support can do anything about it, and I hope I just had a faulty unit and this isn't indicative of the product- If I hear back with any promising news, I'll update this review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz Chitwood

customer_reviews.title: Exellent post-sales warranty services
customer_reviews.text: It's unfortunate that the OCZ 256GB SSD i bought was proved to be defective just one month after use. Although it's so rare to happen, it still happened to me. As the product comes with 5 years warranty, i sent back the SSD and within days i received a new SSD. The post-sales warranty services is smooth and simple, and more importantly it's very fast to get a replacement. Although i was unlucky but i'm very satisfied with the OCZ warranty services.
customer_reviews.author: TEH KHENG BOON

customer_reviews.title: UPGRADE!
customer_reviews.text: SSD's are quite an upgrade - you'll instantly see a big performance increase. It is not compatible with file vault on the Mac, but otherwise no issues.
customer_reviews.author: L. Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: Solid SSD
customer_reviews.text: I have several SSDs installed around the office and they are all good. The Vector is on par with the Samsung 840 Pro and the Vertex 4 although I believe the Samsung seems a little faster. This is a solid SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Chey Harden

customer_reviews.title: Da Vector is Blazin Fast
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a new computer and decided on the ocz vector as my main drive. Had no problems whatsoever at any point of the building/installing windows process. I got an Asus Sabertooth Z77 motherboard and it recognized it right away with no issues. It takes exactly 6 seconds to get to the windows desktop from boot, compared to 25 with my old hard drive. I Highly recommend this baby; its fast; fun; and did i mention its fast??!
customer_reviews.author: Reckoner

customer_reviews.title: Really fast
customer_reviews.text: This drive has made my pc experience a lot better, this SSD is very reliable. Had some problems at first after an power outage but a firmware release fix that. It also came bundled with FarCry 3, good game. In all a good drive, fast and stable
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Lizardo

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the 500GB Hard Drive in the ASUS Ultra Book that I bought and it has dramaticaly increased the performance and reduced the boot time. It probably also has lengthend battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Karl Ruegg, Published Author

customer_reviews.title: Fast as crap
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my gaming build along with a 3570k, z77 extreme4-m, and some decently fast ram. I am not kidding you, my computer starts up in just a few seconds. When I click on Steam it opens up immediately, and same with all the games.
customer_reviews.author: mycahrshelton

customer_reviews.title: SUPER fast, but after only 10 months my computer ...
customer_reviews.text: SUPER fast, but after only 10 months my computer screen freezes and the drive stops working. I take it out, plug it in and it wont even recognize in bios or boot up. Now I have to send it back to the manufacturer for repair.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo

customer_reviews.title: Vector 128gb
customer_reviews.text: I have been considering buying the vertex 4 or samsung 840 pro, Then I saw this model and it got good reviews on the web, and after testing it i can say for sure!! Greate ssd, worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Azoulay

customer_reviews.title: Two in RAID0 works well
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in RAID0 on a Z77 chipset running Windows 8, it is compatible and very fast. Even Trim works. I notice the improvement between these and one 512GB Samsung 830 even though I did not expect to.
customer_reviews.author: Asmodian

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.  Fast O.S. start up.  I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and copy O.S. onto. Starts up system significantly faster Get the price down and it will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Silent SSD
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, It is almost 2 months now, cannot find any errors, Fast and Silent, I can now run the Virtual Box on top of the existing Win 7 without any lag.
customer_reviews.author: Siva Vaidya

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: it just bricked on me after 2 years. thank you 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: The Turk

customer_reviews.title: Its still working
customer_reviews.text: I guess that is the test right? Not much else to say. I installed it about 8 months ago and it's still working just fine, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Falzone

customer_reviews.title: Failed to work
customer_reviews.text: This device is supposed to be 512GB but would be seen and greater than 128GB. OCZ offered a firm ware fix to reset the drive to factory specs, that did not work either. Very disappointed. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Hinton Thomas

customer_reviews.title: solis state drive
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these in my build and have not had any issues with them. they are fast as far as ssd's go.hope some day that the price per bite comes down.so those who want their system to load faster, an ssd is the way to go paired w/ a mechanical hard drive.ocz is another item I prefer for system build.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth allen wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 ssd. A OCZ Vector and a Samsung Pro 840. OCZ is faster than Pro 840, but i think both ssd have very good performance
customer_reviews.author: eldiego77cp

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The SSD stopped working after a little over 2 months after I got it. BIOs won't read this SSD but is able to recognize my HDD. Tried to connect different cables but it still didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Qi Chen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive for my macbook pro to upgrade the 7200RPM drive I had. It is unbelievably faster. Waking from hibernate takes less than five seconds, as apposed to nearly a minute with the hard drive. Instead if waiting on things now, I can expect them to simply work and be fast. Totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: My first SSD. Dramatically reduced boot time over my current hard drive. I would recommend this SSD to anybody who would be looking to improve overall system performance. For those who own older PC's this would be an inexpensive upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Barry P

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this brand SSD if you want your PC to work right!
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is quick but had problems with this from the beginning. It finally crashed completely. Suppose to have a 5 year warranty but the company wouldn't replace it. Had a similar issue with the same SSD on another machine. Beware of these SSD and the company.
customer_reviews.author: angela todd

customer_reviews.title: Very fast
customer_reviews.text: Just as fast as advertised. This makes hard drives seem so slow. It works perfectly in my Mac Pro computer.
customer_reviews.author: Terry LeBeau

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a month!
customer_reviews.text: This drive was awesome to start. I never had an SSD before. Within a month it died for no reason. I will turn this review to a 5 when I get the drive replaced by warranty. Besides the drive dying it was an awesome little bugger.
customer_reviews.author: Kian James

customer_reviews.title: Drive failed after one year of home use.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 11 months. It was really fast. but at 11 months,got a few errors with good recovery at boot up. A month later it crashed and could not recover. A backup at first sign of trouble saved me. I went back to a mechanical drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Love the speed
customer_reviews.text: Installed this as my C drive with a traditional HDD as a D drive. Put all the dynamic info on the D Drive. Fantastic boot time.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: I was able to upgrade to this disk seamlessly. It is very easy to install, and the increase in speed is noticable immediately from start up. The quality of this item is is beyond my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Very fast SSD with solid construction. Works on my laptops having a HDD bay restriction of 7mm height. Be aware it does not come with a 2mm spacer for those needing to fill a 9mm HDD bay.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Super fast SSD
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different SSD, and no doubt this is the fastest one. Cold boot in 26 seconds ready to use any application, and not even using all the speed since is in SATA II mode. Windows Index 7.6 for the disk. Glad I checked all the options and came up with this one.
customer_reviews.author: gsaer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after approximately 530 days
customer_reviews.text: This SSD lasted roughly 530 days before it died. The drive is no longer recognized, even tried different SATA ports on the MB. Keep a constant backup of your data, regardless of using SSD or spinning-disk HDD. I contacted OCZ Technology, after trying a number of things to troubleshoot the SSD, and they issued the RMA within first contact. I'm not happy about sending the drive back, but will be happy once a replacement arrives.
customer_reviews.author: J.MI

customer_reviews.title: Great deal online
customer_reviews.text: Great deal online, had to watch pretty constantly, tho - got two other OCZ drives at work -they've been working great for two years
customer_reviews.author: Blake B Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Boots up alot faster than before and very easy to install as well as it transfers my music 10 x faster highly recommended for people transferring files and i forgot to mention if your into gaming like iam the load times are alot faster too
customer_reviews.author: Alex ortiz

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good! can't say anything bad about it great piece of gear for a laptop or desktop. make sure you have SATA IIId
customer_reviews.text: Great Drive no issues, have other OCZ SSD's can't say anything bad about it great piece of gear for a laptop or desktop. make sure you have SATA IIId
customer_reviews.author: Kris Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: its been more than 6 months that I'm using just try on my actual PC every day from morning till night and it works perfectly. ik but this drive as a replacement to my original hard drive and I have to say the speed and performance is not even comparable to that regular hard drives, if you ever want to get a SSD drive this would be the one to go. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amiraras

customer_reviews.title: Amazin!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Product for its great performance and efficiency with perfect price, I recomemned this product to everyone need to upgrade his HDD or even the SSD
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim Hamdy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: after two weeks it is not being recognized by the Motherboard anymore =/
customer_reviews.author: Luiz Mello

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Fast, sleek, and efficient. A little pricey but that's what you have to pay for with good technology. I thought it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Clownie

customer_reviews.title: its a scam...
customer_reviews.text: bought this last august, installed windows 7 ultimate 64bit and now??????? issues after issues..... it crashes and created a lot of problems... now I can no longer use my newly assembled computer... I wonder if Amazon will replace this... I hate this product! I am sorry but this must be a joke product... Any body tell me which SSD is more reliable please...
customer_reviews.author: curiosity

customer_reviews.title: Alienware m14x upgraded w vector - great product
customer_reviews.text: Alienware m14x successfully upgraded w vector 256 GB . OS boot up and several apps performance noticeably improved. So far so good. nice product worked right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: marzg63

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with this SSD
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this SSD. Until one day it just stopped working after some mild usage. I searched internet about issues people get with it and found out some bad things.
customer_reviews.author: Tural Sadik

customer_reviews.title: Died at 11 Months.
customer_reviews.text: Died at 11 Months. no warning and lost some data. Thankfully not a lot because I have backups but still sucks that they can't get a drive to even last a year.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Want the best? Try OCZ.
customer_reviews.text: I moved to this unit from another SSD, the performance is definitely increased. Plus, the package is beautiful, with a 2.5 to 3.5 adapter included. OCZ stays at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Sulis

customer_reviews.title: love my vector
customer_reviews.text: my system boots up 5 seconds with the vector. it was so simple to install, i can't imagine not having one.
customer_reviews.author: mark jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Item delivered as expected or better in quality and service. Just goes to show, there are good deals to be had on the internet. Customer is very happy :-)
customer_reviews.author: PhatPapi

customer_reviews.title: Just as fast as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far my only complaint has been with the rebate handling people. The drive works great. Don't forget to update your firmware! Always very important with SSDs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: ed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product rendimineto greatly improved my desktop computer, both in the writing speed of the progrmas like reading the same,
customer_reviews.author: Edward H. Zambrano R.

customer_reviews.title: I love the design and its sleek
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my thunderbolt adapter and this little piece of hardware rocks. The only things like many and most drive it the heat factor, but the open environment provided by the adapter provides enough openness for the heat to disipate. Overall, a great buy for video projects that loads and unloads files very fast. I will no longer buy moving parts drives. In due time these will get cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Terrence Quinsaat

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January 2013, and it broke down today (August 26th, 2013). It only lasted for 7 month. First, it start lagging, then it is totally corrupted, non bootable. I tried using usb live stick to mount or detect the drive without any success. It is all gone, my photo and data are all gone now. I did not expect such short life time for a popular hard drive. Beware, if you are buying this, you might want to backup everything and assume it will break down any moment. (No clicking sound as traditional hard drive) I am very disappointed on OCZ Technology.
customer_reviews.author: Cheng Lai Victor Huang

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: It's really fast, boot time about 10 seconds on a macbook pro i7 2.3ghz (yes you can install it on mac and use a trim enabler). Blackmagic speeds 445mb/s write 495mb/s read. Faster that what I've watch the Retina SSD go. I wont give it 5 starts because while trying to make a full backup the computer crashed several times only to find out there where like 10-20 corrupted files. Had to delete them before completing the backup (luckily had a backup of this files). For now I've got everything in a NAS server and a backup just in case. Would recommend this SSD but always have a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Figari

customer_reviews.title: OCZ Technology 256GB Vector Series SATA 6.0
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Installed it in my Toshiba R835-P56X, now cold boots in 28 sec. even though the R835 in NOT SATA 3.
customer_reviews.author: Pbilling

product_meta.title: OCZ Technology 128GB Vector Series SATA 6.0 GB/s 7 mm Height 2.5-Inch SSD with 95K IOPS And 5-Year Warranty- VTR1-25SAT3-128G
product_meta.description:
Capacity:128 GBThe industry’s best SSDs just got better.Meet the storage expectations you didn’t know you had. Engineered by longtime SSD experts, the OCZ Vector Series delivers a new level of untouchable performance, endurance, and reliability designed to empower your laptop or desktop to be all it can be.There is a faster, more responsive computing experience inside this box.Imagine faster file transfers, quicker boot ups, and a computer that responds the way it was designed to (minus the hard drive) and you’ve got yourself a Vector SSD. It’s a 2.5-inch solid state powerhouse. If you want lasting reliability, durability, and stealth operation, here it is.With groundbreaking SSD quality and technology in every drive, the Vector Series is built to provide years of hard drive-humiliating performance that is second to no other storage solution.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The groundbreaking Vector Series SSD from OCZ (view larger). Delivering exceptional I/O performance plus enhanced reliability and endurance, groundbreaking Vector Series SSD from OCZ is designed to empower your laptop or desktop to be all it can be. 

With OCZ's next-generation Indilinx Barefoot 3 controller, the Vector SSD consistently delivers superior sustained performance over time regardless of whether the data streams are in compressed or uncompressed formats. As a result, the groundbreaking Vector provides faster file transfers and boot-ups, and a quicker, more responsive storage experience.

This 2.5-inch SSD (model VTR1-25SAT3-128G) has a 128 GB capacity, which offers a sequential read bandwidth of up to 550 MB/s, sequential write bandwidth of up to 400 MB/s, random read performance of up to 90,000 IOPS, and random write performance of up to 95,000 IOPS (input/output operations per second). 

Vector delivers the industry's fastest performance. Rated for 100,000 random read and 95,000 random write IOPS to deliver ultimate responsiveness and a better overall computing and workstation experience than any other storage solution.



Vector redefines reliability and offers a premium SSD solution designed from the ground up for enhanced stability, quality, and durability.




Get consistently faster sustained speeds with the complete spectrum of file types and sizes, including both compressible and incompressible data for balanced, long-lasting performance like no other drive out there.



Built to last, Vector maximizes drive life with low write amplification, efficient garbage collection, and an advanced suite of NAND flash management to provide years of hard drive-humiliating performance that is second to none.





KEY FEATURES
 * Advanced suite of NAND flash management keeps your drive at higher sustained performance over the long term for maximum endurance.
   
   
 * Excels in both incompressible and compressible data types such as multimedia, encrypted data, ZIP files, and software.
   
   
 * Cutting-edge controller technology delivers maximum performance and unmatched endurance without compression or loss of usable capacity, rated for 20 GB/day of host writes for 5 years (typical client workloads).
   
   
 * Sleek alloy housing offers slimmer 7mm z-height for compatibility with the latest thinner form factor notebooks.
   
   
 * Bundled with a 3.5-inch desktop adapter bracket and an Acronis True Image cloning software registration key (Windows compatible) to easily transfer data from your old hard drive.

Just 7mm thin (view larger). WHICH OCZ VECTOR SSD IS RIGHT FOR YOU?
VTR1-25SAT3-128G VTR1-25SAT3-256G VTR1-25SAT3-512G Performance Capacity 128 GB 256 GB 512 GB Sequential Reads 550 MB/s 550 MB/s 550 MB/s Sequential Writes 400 MB/s 530 MB/s 530 MB/s Random 4k Read 95,000 IOPS 95,000 IOPS 95,000 IOPS Random 4k Write 90,000 IOPS 100,000 IOPS 100,000 IOPS Physical NAND Components 25nm Multi-Level Cell (MLC) NAND Flash Interface SATA III / 6 Gbps Form Factor 2.5-inch; 7mm height NAND Controller Indilinx Barefoot 3 DRAM Cache Up to 1 GB Dimensions 99.7 x 69.75 x 7mm Weight 115g Reliability/Compatibility Power Consumption Idle -- 0.9W; Active -- 2.25 watts Performance Optimizations TRIM, Idle Time Garbage Collection Data Path Protection BCH ECC corrects up to 28 random bits/1KB Product Health Monitoring Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology (SMART) Support Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) 1.3 million hours OS Compatibility Windows, Linux, Mac OS X THE SSD ADVANTAGE
Whether you're refreshing an older laptop or trying to maximize the potential of the latest platform, SSDs provide substantial benefits over traditional hard drives.

FASTER PERFORMANCE
SSDs have 100x greater throughput and instantaneous access times for quicker boot ups, faster file transfers, and overall snappier performance than hard drives.



COST-EFFECTIVENESS
Because many HDDs are needed to achieve the same performance, SSDs offer greater cost effectiveness for IOPS per dollar.



GREATER DURABILITY
The non-mechanical design of NAND flash mounted to circuit boards are shock resistant up to 1500g, unlike HDDs with various moving parts.



LESS POWER
SSDs use significantly less wattage at peak load than hard drives, delivering longer battery life in notebooks, less power strain on system, and a cooler computing environment.



SILENT OPERATION
With no moving parts, SSDs run virtually silent in your notebook or PC case to eliminate distracting noises during gaming or entertainment.
feature_bullets: Bundled with a 3.5-inch desktop adapter bracket and an Acronis True Image cloning software registration key (Windows compatible) to easily transfer data from your old hard drive

4k Random Write: 90K IOPS; 4k Random Read: 95K IOPS
